title: Download Pointwise
description: Download the latest production release of the Pointwise mesh generation software for all supported platforms.
copy:
Download Pointwise

The current production release of Pointwise and its license manager (RLM, Reprise License Manager) can be downloaded from this page with options for downloading the software, the license manager, or both.


Note that a valid license is required to run the software. Current customers will need to update to a V18.4 license.

Request an updated license here: www.pointwise.com/licenses

The current release is Pointwise V18.4 R3.

Pointwise currently supports Windows, Linux, and macOS 64-bit systems. For more information about the minimum requirements for each of those platforms, please see our Supported Platforms page.

Pointwise + License Manager

Choose this option if you are installing for the first time and need both Pointwise and the Reprise License Manager (RLM).

License Manager Only

Choose this option if you only need to set up an RLM license server.

Pointwise Only

Choose this option if you have an established RLM license server and only need Pointwise installed.

Tutorial Workbook Files

The Tutorial Workbook is automatically included with each Pointwise installation and is accessible through the Pointwise interface via the Help menu. We recommend that you follow the beginner, intermediate, and advanced tutorials within the workbook to learn about common Pointwise commands and workflows.

Most tutorials in the workbook use at least one initial file - typically either a CAD file (e.g. .iges, .stl) or a Pointwise project file (.pw). Some tutorials also offer intermediate and final Pointwise project files that allow you to compare your work with the intended tutorial results. All tutorial files can be downloaded in .tgz format by clicking below.

Download

Glyph Scripting Documentation

Glyph is Pointwise's scripting language. It is an extension to the Tcl scripting language that allows access to the commands and entities of the Pointwise application.

The Glyph documentation is available on our website. For our users with limited internet access, you can now download these files in a .tgz format by clicking below.

Download

title: Download and Install Pointwise
description: Download the latest production release of the Pointwise mesh generation software for all supported platforms including installation instructions.
copy:
Installing Pointwise

Pointwise V18.4 uses the Reprise License Manager (RLM). Customers who do not have RLM will need to obtain a license and perform a complete download and install. For more information, or to see answers to the most common installation questions, please see our Get Help page.


Note that a valid license is required to run the software. Current customers will need to update to a V18.4 license.

Request an updated license here: www.pointwise.com/licenses/

1. Download Pointwise.

The current production release is Pointwise V18.4 R3.
Platform (Right click, Save Link As…) Size (MB)
Windows 64-bit pw-V18.4R3-win64-jre.exe 230
Linux 64-bit pw-V18.4R3-linux_x86_64-jre.sh 289
macOS 64-bit pw-V18.4R3-macosx.dmg 327

2. Install Pointwise.

  1. Run the Pointwise installer.
    1. IMPORTANT: Install Pointwise as Administrator/root on Windows machines.
  2. Accept the Right-to-Use license and use all defaults for the installation.
  3. Pointwise should launch after you click Finish.
    1. If Pointwise cannot find an RLM license server, the Pointwise License Wizard will appear.
    2. If you have an Activation Key, select Specify an Activation Key and enter your Key.
    3. If you would like to use an existing license server, select Specify a License Server and enter the name of your server.

3. Have Questions?

  • Check our Get Help webpage for answers to common questions, troubleshooting tips, and installation help.
  • Verify that your platform is supported by Pointwise.
  • Contact Pointwise's technical support team at support@pointwise.com and 800-4PT-WISE.

The terms of the agreement under which you may acquire the right to use the software include the "Right To Use License" attached hereto or accompanying the software. Your purchase, license, receipt, or use of the software constitutes your acceptance of all the "Right To Use License". Please read the Right To Use License.

description: Information on what issues were resolved in this release of Pointwise can be found in the Pre-Release Notes.

title: Installing Pointwise & License Manager
description: Download the latest production release of the Pointwise mesh generation software for all supported platforms including installation instructions.
copy:
Installing Pointwise & License Manager

Customers who do not have RLM will need to obtain a license and perform a complete download and install. For more information, or to see answers to the most common installation questions, please see our Get Help page.


Note that a valid license is required to run the software. Current customers will need to update to a V18.4 license.

1. Request an Activation Key.

An activation key is a 16-digit numeric string used during the Reprise License Manager (RLM) installation process to contact Pointwise for information on the number of processes licensed and their expiration date. For best results, we recommend that you have your activation key prior to beginning installation. If you do not already have an activation key, you can request one at www.pointwise.com/licenses.

2. Download Reprise License Manager (RLM).

Complete Installation Files for License Manager
Platform (Right-click, Save Link As…) Size (MB)
Windows 64-bit pwrlm-V12.3-win64-jre.exe 42
Linux 64-bit pwrlm-V12.3-linux_x86_64-jre.sh 42
macOS 64-bit pwrlm-V12.3-macosx.dmg 38

3. Install the RLM license manager.

  1. Run RLM installer.
    1. IMPORTANT: Install Pointwise as Administrator/root on Windows machines.
  2. Accept the Right-to-Use license and use all defaults for the installation.
  3. If you have an Activation Key, copy and paste it into the Activation Key field when you reach the Configure Pointwise RLM License Server screen.
  4. If your Activation Key does not work or you need an Activation Key, please contact support@pointwise.com.

4. Review the status of your RLM license manager.

  1. Start your web browser and open http://localhost:5054/ where localhost is your computer's name. This is the Reprise License Manager (RLM) user interface page.
  2. On the left side of the web page, click on the Status button.
  3. You should now see an ISV (Independent Software Vendor) program name PWID listed as running.
  4. If you do not, please contact support@pointwise.com.

5. Download Pointwise.

The current production release is Pointwise V18.4 R3.
Platform (Right click, Save Link As…) Size (MB)
Windows 64-bit pw-V18.4R3-win64-jre.exe 230
Linux 64-bit pw-V18.4R3-linux_x86_64-jre.sh 289
macOS 64-bit pw-V18.4R3-macosx.dmg 327

6. Install Pointwise.

  1. Run the Pointwise installer.
    1. IMPORTANT: Install Pointwise as Administrator/root on Windows machines.
  2. Accept the Right-to-Use license and use all defaults for the installation.
  3. Pointwise should launch after you click Finish.
    1. If Pointwise cannot find an RLM license server, the Pointwise License Wizard will appear.
    2. If you have an Activation Key, select Specify an Activation Key and enter your Key.
    3. If you would like to use an existing license server, select Specify a License Server and enter the name of your server.

7. Have Questions?

  • Check our Get Help webpage for answers to common questions, troubleshooting tips, and installation help.
  • Verify that your platform is supported by Pointwise.
  • Contact Pointwise's technical support team at support@pointwise.com and 800-4PT-WISE.

The terms of the agreement under which you may acquire the right to use the software include the "Right To Use License" attached hereto or accompanying the software. Your purchase, license, receipt, or use of the software constitutes your acceptance of all the "Right To Use License". Please read the Right To Use License.

title: Installing the License Manager
description: Pointwise now uses RLM, the Reprise License Manager.
copy:
Installing the License Manager

Customers who do not have RLM will need to obtain a license and perform a complete download and install. For more information, or to see answers to the most common installation questions, please see our Get Help page.


Note that a valid license is required to run the software. Current customers will need to update to a V18.4 license.

1. Request an Activation Key.

An activation key is a 16-digit numeric string used during the Reprise License Manager (RLM) installation process to contact Pointwise for information on the number of processes licensed and their expiration date. For best results, we recommend that you have your activation key prior to beginning installation. If you do not already have an activation key, you can request one at www.pointwise.com/licenses.

2. Download Reprise License Manager (RLM).

Complete Installation Files for License Manager
Platform (Right-click, Save Link As…) Size (MB)
Windows 64-bit pwrlm-V12.3-win64-jre.exe 42
Linux 64-bit pwrlm-V12.3-linux_x86_64-jre.sh 42
macOS 64-bit pwrlm-V12.3-macosx.dmg 38

3. Install the RLM license manager.

  1. Run RLM installer.
    1. IMPORTANT: Install Pointwise as Administrator/root on Windows machines.
  2. Accept the Right-to-Use license and use all defaults for the installation.
  3. If you have an Activation Key, copy and paste it into the Activation Key field when you reach the Configure Pointwise RLM License Server screen.
  4. If your Activation Key does not work or you need an Activation Key, please contact support@pointwise.com.

4. Review the status of your RLM license manager.

  1. Start your web browser and open http://localhost:5054/ where localhost is your computer's name. This is the Reprise License Manager (RLM) user interface page.
  2. On the left side of the web page, click on the Status button.
  3. You should now see an ISV (Independent Software Vendor) program name PWID listed as running.
  4. If you do not, please contact support@pointwise.com

5. Have you installed Pointwise yet?

Go to www.pointwise.com/downloads/pointwise.html and download the latest version of Pointwise.

6. Have Questions?

  • Check our Get Help webpage for answers to common questions, troubleshooting tips, and installation help.
  • Verify that your platform is supported by Pointwise.
  • Contact Pointwise's technical support team at support@pointwise.com and 800-4PT-WISE.

The terms of the agreement under which you may acquire the right to use the software include the "Right To Use License" attached hereto or accompanying the software. Your purchase, license, receipt, or use of the software constitutes your acceptance of all the "Right To Use License". Please read the Right To Use License.
